Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration because the goal of administering 100 million shots in the first 100 days was already close to being achieved before President Biden took office.
Understate: The claim may be seen as understating the progress made in vaccine administration before President Biden took office, as the daily average was already close to the goal of 1 million doses per day.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific data or evidence to back up the assertion that the goal will not only be reached but also exceeded.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the progress made so far is indicative of the future trend, without considering potential challenges or setbacks that may arise.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not acknowledge alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to the progress made in vaccine administration, such as efforts by previous administrations or external factors like vaccine availability.
